entry.title: How to update the child component in React(using props)
entry.content:
How to update the child component in React(using props)

So recently I am writing a Project that to reuse the component which is some kinds of buttons, and this is how I wrote it (within only one file)

and this is how I use it:

And here come‚Äôs the issue: when I click the Buttons(call onClick and change save value), it should render a new Buttons( because saved change ),but in fact, it didn‚Äôt, why?

So I search online, and it said like this:

Passing the intial state to a component as a prop is an anti-pattern because the getInitialState (in our case the constuctor) method is only called the first time the component renders. Never more. Meaning that, if you re-render that component passing a different value as a prop, the component will not react accordingly, because the component will keep the state from the first time it was rendered. It‚Äôs very error prone.

which means props is read-only,I can‚Äôt change it.

So if can‚Äôt avoid such a situation the ideal solution is to use the method componentWillReceiveProps to listen for new props.

entry.title: Interview with React
entry.content:
Q:

  1. What issue did React solve?
  2. How to create and Design a good component?
  3. When will render() being called in Component?
  4. Will DOM always refresh and update when render being called?
  5. lifecycle of Component
  6. Which period should handle remote data loading?
  7. In which life cycle the state can be changed?
  8. When the state in different Componet(not parent releatice) need to mutally change, how to do with it?
  9. What content should be in state?
  10. How to optimize the Component?
  11. What is the key properties in the component
  12. The different between Component, Element and Instance
  13. What happen when calling setState?
  14. When to use Class Component and when to use Functional Component
  15. What is refs and why is it important?
  16. The difference between Controlled Component and Uncontrolled Compoent
  17. Descripted how React dealing with event

What issue did React solve?

a. Implementing Virtual DOM
What the Virtulal DOM did is: Caluculating the differnence between the old and new data and make the necessary DOM update which highly get rid of some unnecessary DOM update.For the DOM will re-rendering the whole application, resetting the innerHTML, even it is a tiny change on the page, which is performance reducing.

b. Componenilize
Obviously, we can divide the whole application into seperate piece, which make the project more manageable, readable and reusable, which increase the efficient of development

c. Unidirectional data flow
In React the data flow are only one way ‚Äî from parent to child, if the props on parent side change, then it will recursively passing the props to all the child components and re-rendering the them. So it let the data flows straightforward and easy to maintenances

How to create and design a good Component

The goal of using Component in React is to the future reuse, so in the design of components need to follow the principle of high cohesion low coupling.

  • React recommand to combine the component instead of inherit the component, so try not to make a large component.
  • Using high level component (A React compoent which packaged another React component) to achieve reusable component. It contains the props delegate and reverse inheritance.
  • Seperate logical parts and view parts
  • Finally, writing well-orgainized code

When will render() being called in Component?

  • When the state change(setState)
  • When the props change
  • There is a componentShouldUpdate Function and the default value is true. As we can rewrite the code and manipulate render()

Will DOM always refresh and update when render being called?

Not really

There are two kinds of DOM in React, when the render() get called, React will re-create a virtual DOM tree according to props or state.Although each time calling will re-generate, it happens on memory, it won‚Äôt affect the performance. And the virtual DOM update does not mean that the real DOM update, React uses the diff algorithm to compare the virtual DOM to the real DOM, which find out the smallest part needs to update, and then real DOM will update

So every time a state change causes the render function to be called but the real page DOM does not necessarily to be changed

lifecycle of Component

Including three stages: Initialization, Updating, Unmouting

Initializtion

  • constructor() : Initiating state and binding
  • componentWillMount() : as what it means
  • render()
  • componentDidMount() : Instantly initiate after render() get called

Updating

  • componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps)ÔºöInitiating when the componet receiving new props
  • componentShouldUpdate(nextPropsÔºånextState)Ôºöreturn true(defalut value)
  • componentWillUpdate()Ôºö Initisting when componentShouldUpdate get called
  • render()
  • componentDidUpdate(): Instantly initiate after render() get called

Unmouting

  • componentWillUnmount()
  • componentDidMount()

Which period should handle remote data loading?

  • componentDidMount(), because it is a async requesting, We want the data being processed after all the componet being rendered, if the data requesting completed before all component are rendered, some of the under rendering Component will not get the new state

    Warning: setState(...): Can only update a mounted or mounting component. This usually means you called setState() on an unmounted component.

In which life cycle the state can be changed?

  • componentDidMount and componentDidUpdate
  • constructor„ÄÅcomponentWillMount will cause error : as show aboved
  • setState in componentWillUpdate will cause dead lock

entry.title: why we should use Redux in React
entry.content:
Why We Should Use

The Idea of developing everythings in Component released the hard working on operation on DOM. For React, everything is state, through the state can control the view changes. But as the project keeping expends and mroe and more function are intergrated in, many states become so unmanageable that as different components trigger changes in the same state and lead to updates to the view, we may not know exactly what happened and state changes have become somewhat unpredictable and not Controlled, Redux came into being, limiting the timing and manner of stateful updates through the practice and enhancement of Flux thinking, and Redux attempted to make state changes predictable.

Three Principles of Redux

1. Single data source.

The applications only have the single data source, the entire state of the application are stored in an object, which providing the persistence of extracting the status for entire application.Mean while, combineReducers (Redux API) provides a efficiently solution for dealing with large data sources

2.Read only State

In Redux, we change the state through reducer instead of setState() and depending on the type of action which being triggered . reducer(previousState, action) => newState

3.Using Pure function to complete the change of state

Using reducer to complete the state change, every reducer is a pure function
